top_categories.workout_context: Ouray Gravel Grinder’s mixed terrain demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 80 miles, Ouray Gravel Grinder punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Ouray Gravel Grinder isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Every session at Ouray Gravel Grinder intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Ouray Gravel Grinder rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Ouray Gravel Grinder when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
Ouray Gravel Grinder’s mixed terrain and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Ouray Gravel Grinder. Make this intensity feel like home.
Ouray Gravel Grinder’s 7,800ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Ouray Gravel Grinder — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.
High-volume endurance builds the aerobic base that makes Ouray Gravel Grinder’s race-day efforts sustainable rather than destructive.
Cadence efficiency makes every pedal stroke at Ouray Gravel Grinder count — smooth technique reduces muscular fatigue over long distances.

race_overlay.heat: September in Ouray, Colorado. Begin heat acclimatization 10–14 days before Ouray Gravel Grinder — 20–30min sauna sessions or midday rides in full kit. Pre-load sodium 48 hours out. Target 500–750ml/hr with electrolytes on race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Ouray Gravel Grinder’s 80 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.altitude: Ouray Gravel Grinder with 7,800ft of climbing, much of it above 8,000ft demands altitude preparation. Arrive 5–7 days early for acclimatization. Expect 5–15% power reduction at altitude. Increase iron intake 4 weeks out. Hydrate aggressively — altitude increases fluid loss by 20–40%.
race_overlay.terrain: Highly technical terrain at Ouray Gravel Grinder demands practice on similar surfaces. Ride mixed terrain at race-day cadence weekly. Practice cornering, descending, and power delivery on unstable surfaces. Dial in tire pressure before race week — 5 PSI wrong costs you 15+ minutes over 80 miles.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Durability, and Race Simulation to prepare you for 80 miles of mixed terrain in Ouray, Colorado.
